column4: I need a little hint for merging two   ext3  partions , please !
no
it doesn`t
try with gparted (umounted partitions use a livecd) but messing with partitions is risky business backup first
i know but i am out of space !
move the home to the new partition
i will try with a live cd with gparrted
ok
how?
i have a 5 Giga partition and it is full with applications that i need it
if you have a new ext3 partition move all files of home to it then add a line to fstab to mount the new part in /home at boot time
if i change home to new partition ... application will still install into my 5 giga partition
yes
but i was under the impresion that the bigger files where in home
no ... i don`t have big files in home
ops
and neither partion magic don`t merge ext2/3
then try gparted with all the warnings. i do not make any warranty
gparted won`t merge my partiotions because one is mounted !!!
i told you to do it from a livecd (knoppix comes with qparted)
i will try damn small linux!!
backup important data
ok... in pursuit!
thanks!
